summary: This document is an email chain from November 29, 2021, regarding an urgent update to the public victim notice page for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The correspondence involves court staff coordinating to correct outdated dial-in information and clarify that proceedings are in-person only.

persons.name: Edward Friedland
persons.context: He is the District Court Executive for the Southern District of New York who identifies that outdated information on the Maxwell victim webpage is causing public confusion and requests an update to reflect the latest court order for in-person attendance.

persons.name: Joseph Pecorino
persons.role: Office of the District Executive staff
persons.context: He works in the Office of the District Executive for the Southern District of New York and forwards a link to the Maxwell case webpage, prompting the request for an update to the victim notice information.

persons.name: Matthew Rogers
persons.context: He is copied on the initial email from Edward Friedland regarding the outdated Maxwell victim webpage information, indicating his involvement in the court's administrative or victim notification process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of the criminal case referenced throughout the email chain; the correspondence concerns updating public information for victims related to her trial.

connections.description: Friedland, as District Court Executive, corresponds with Pecorino, who is in the Office of the District Executive, to address and correct administrative information regarding the Maxwell case webpage.
Friedland copies Rogers on an email regarding the outdated Maxwell victim notice, indicating a collaborative or supervisory relationship within the court's administrative functions.
Pecorino sends Friedland a link to the Maxwell case webpage, which Friedland then identifies as containing outdated information requiring correction.

events.title: Urgent Update to Maxwell Victim Notice
events.description: Court staff exchange emails to urgently update the public victim notice webpage for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, correcting outdated dial-in information and clarifying that proceedings are in-person only as per a recent court order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Outdated information on the Department of Justice's Maxwell case webpage was causing members of the public to incorrectly attempt to access the trial proceedings by phone.
A recent court order mandated that the Maxwell trial proceedings were to be attended in-person, necessitating the removal of old dial-in information from the victim notice page.
The email chain demonstrates administrative coordination within the U.S. District Court to ensure accurate public communication regarding victim access to the high-profile Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
